column2: postContent

Today, Memorial Hermann Health System officially launched Epic with our first wave of users. Thanks to the efforts of over 2,000 team members and our partners at Epic, we're transforming the experience across our medical group, affiliated practices, clinics, pharmacies, and employer solutions with a transformed experience that will help improve the care we deliver to our patients.

This extensive, two-year journey has touched nearly every part of our organization, marking one of the most significant transformations in my career. I'm eager to see the positive changes as we settle into operational efficiency and our patients engage with new digital experiences.

Congratulations to everyone involved, especially Amanda Hammel and Rick Lyman, DSL, MBA for their pivotal roles in guiding this effort. #EPICTransition #DigitalInnovation #PatientExperience

For over 20 years, Mirada Medical has delivered cutting edge technology to the market.  Mirada goes beyond simple detection, because our customers, radiologists, are asked for more than simple detection.  Radiologists must communicate their findings to treating physicians.  Mirada goes the extra mile by not only helping radiologists find the disease, we also help radiologists communicate the findings through annotations that mirror clinical practice.

That depth of industry expertise is what sets Mirada apart. Julien Willaime and Georgia Ionescu, PhD and the rest of our team continues to push the boundary for our customers.

Customers like you trust Sonoco, because our teams are exceptional. John Rossetti is just one of Sonoco’s many technical team experts. He uses his 27 years of specialized experience to train core winder operators, select corestock products for specific applications and more.

Read more about John and his team looking out for customers on our blog: https://lnkd.in/eGfqRVz6

I was honored to address my peers on the evolution of the CIO role at Evanta’s Minneapolis CIO Summit this week. Among other insights, I shared the value of networking, building business acumen, and having a customer-centric approach.

It was great to see so many familiar faces and meet new CIOs, as we connected on the critical challenges and priorities facing our role today. Thank you to Shelby Lingo and Zander Petersen for inviting me to participate!

With a nod to the past and an eye to the future, Culligan has a new brand identity that we’re in the process of rolling out worldwide.

Our rebranding efforts are centered around a clear message: choosing Culligan means choosing a brand dedicated to consumers and their well-being. Our brand story showcases our commitment to making a positive impact on people's lives every day by improving the health and safety of water.

Great to see our team members in Austria, Chile, U.K. and Florida with Culligan’s new logo on service vehicles, company signage, branded polos and more. I love the enthusiasm around our brand evolution.

Since our founding in 2012, the security of our customers’ data has been our highest priority. That’s why the recent cyber security threat targeting some of our customers has been unsettling, especially given that we, and cybersecurity experts Mandiant (part of Google Cloud) and CrowdStrike, have found no evidence to suggest that unauthorized access to Snowflake customer accounts stemmed from a breach of Snowflake's enterprise environment.

Mandiant released their investigative report on the threat on June 10th confirming our preliminary findings that we had begun sharing with our customers on May 24th.

Key Mandiant findings include:

▪ Every incident Mandiant responded to associated with this campaign was traced back to compromised customer credentials.
▪ The impacted accounts were not configured with multi-factor authentication enabled, meaning successful authentication only required a valid username and password.
▪ Credentials identified in infostealer malware output were still valid, in some cases years after they were stolen, and had not been rotated or updated.
▪ The impacted Snowflake customer instances did not have network allow lists in place to only allow access from trusted locations.

We operate under a shared responsibility security model with our customers – with them having the responsibility to follow best practices when configuring networks and enforcing secure authentication methods for access to their systems – and now we plan to strengthen this model by requiring more stringent protections.

In the coming weeks, we will be providing a feature for administrators of Snowflake accounts to make multi-factor authentication (MFA) mandatory for all users; ultimately moving to MFA by default. While we target to roll out the enhanced authentication policies by the end of June, we are going to do this in a controlled and staged way alongside close communication and enablement. By doing so, we’ll not only be helping our customers better protect themselves, but we’ll also be leading the industry to what we believe will become an industry standard.

We are also accelerating in-product capabilities, such as our Trust Center. This new active audit and monitoring capability is expected to be generally available by the end of June, with additional transparency specifically around MFA and network policies.

This is in addition to other actions we’ve already taken, like locking customer accounts where we saw cyber threat activity, working closely with affected customers to help them better protect themselves, and communicating with all of our customers to harden their security measures.

You have our commitment that the security of your data will always be our highest priority.

column2:
Last week, we experienced the ultimate Consumer Health Care – focused event, The inaugural Optum 💥"ConsumerCon”💥, where our teams of Product, Engineering, Design, Business and Operations collaborated to create outstanding digital experiences, and shape the future of customer-focused healthcare experiences ⚡🧡⚡ .
A huge THANK You to the cross UnitedHealth Group teams and leaders who came together to make this happen!

The two-day event was full of insights and learnings. Here are some of the highlights:
🧡 Rita Khan and I jointly shared the need for a unified consumer digital strategy, essential digital capabilities, and the value of data-driven insights.
🧡 Sandeep Dadlani shared valuable advice on how to avoid pitfalls that hinder a culture of fast innovation and growth at scale.
🧡 Professor Peter Fader led discussions on customer lifetime value and its power in creating the most important experiences for our members and patients
🧡 Katie Schumacher and Jared Carr led a session to identify solutions for key consumer pain points, and shared their “why” .
🧡 Chris Hanson turned product development into a fun, agile-building exercise with Lego models (who would have thought?)
🧡 Terry Clark showed us why it matters to advocate for solutions that meet individual healthcare needs.
🧡 Robbi Thatcher moderated a panel that brought insight from consumer advocates, who inspired all of us to be closer to our customers.
🧡 And finally, we engaged in a “design jam” with Anna Stoesz, Cindy Tam, and Bridget Feickert to learn more about rapid prototyping, the role of research, and top UX trends that emphasize iteration to support a continuous experience evolution.

A heartfelt thank you 🙏 to everyone involved in organizing ConsumerCon.!!

#Optum #OptumTech #UHG #DigitalHealthcare #Innovation #Digitaltransformation #CustomerExperience #UnitedHealthGroup

Why is getting care at a comprehensive cancer center important? 🤔 

Studies show that you get better care, which leads to better outcomes and longer-term success.

For over 50 years, Roswell Park has maintained a Comprehensive Designation from the NCI. And we’re proud to share that in our latest renewal, we were rated “Exceptional,” the highest rating a cancer center can achieve.🎉🏅
column23: And some of my friends ask “why?”… We are Roswell Park Comprehensive Cancer Center.

Improve Digital Health Cyber Resiliency to Effectively Prevent, Detect, and Respond to Ransomware Attacks: https://lnkd.in/gtFWBSXt

As a leading competitor for digital health cyber resiliency solutions, First Health focuses on controls and cyber posture to inform the most effective approach to incident response planning and ransomware resiliency. Our cyber clinicians review the client's current tools, controls, policies, and procedures to align them with contemporary ransomware technology and tactics. Our team helps clients to address key risk factors, backup patient data, and develop clinical playbooks to assure downtime procedures will be effective in the event of a shutdown. First Health clients receive actionable technical and strategic recommendations to reduce the likelihood and impact of ransomware to improve overall cyber resilience and protection of critical assets.

For more on First Health's Ransomware Prevention, Recovery, & Resiliency Services, visit https://lnkd.in/gtFWBSXt or contact sales@firsthealthadvisory.com

column2:
When we designed the Jefferson Health Honickman Center, our new state-of-the-art outpatient care center, we knew we wanted to create much more than a traditional healthcare facility. We hoped to foster a true sense of #community, so we created an adjoining public plaza that could be activated for special events, fitness classes, and more. 
 
This week, at Jefferson Plaza, we hosted the #Jefferson200 Block Party in partnership with the city’s annual Wawa, Inc. Welcome America festival. It was a celebration of #innovation and #education as we recognized Jefferson’s rich 200-year legacy and commitment to Greater #Philadelphia. Live music, a DJ, free food, giveaways, #health resources, and a cornhole tournament for Jefferson staff, were some of the highlights. We even had an incredible performance by Philly’s own Kathy Sledge, a founding member of the iconic group Sister Sledge. 
 
The most meaningful part of the day was that our team kicked off the party with a service project to make 500 sandwiches for Our Brother’s Place shelter. Volunteerism has been a key part of our #bicentennial celebration as we’ve committed to at least 200,000 hours of service in honor of 200 years. We’re half way toward that goal and we’re just getting started. 
 
Thanks to all who came out to what I hope is just one of many special moments on #JeffersonPlaza. 
 
#healthcare #communityhealth #healthequity #communityservice
column11: Executive Vice President and Chief Strategy Officer
column26: Ray Anderson, PhD, MBA likes this

column2: UBC is at the forefront of finding creative ways to put #patientsfirst!

Take a little trip with us through the Mercy Center for Performance Medicine & Specialty Care, which opened its doors just over a year ago as one of the largest multispecialty surgery centers in the country. Offering orthopedic specialties, weight loss surgery, neurosurgery, precision medicine and more, this facility was designed from the ground up to offer a one-of-a-kind patient experience that puts your convenience and health as the top priority.

Today, we announced a significant expansion of our HIV screening services since debuting them at two pharmacies in Virginia late last year. We’re adding 10 additional HIV screening locations across Virginia and eight in Colorado, bringing our total number of HIV point-of-care screening locations to 20. According to the CDC, 13 percent of people in Virginia with HIV, and 13 percent of people in Colorado with HIV, are unaware of their status. It’s our hope that this expansion will increase access, reduce stigma and connect people to care in ways they haven’t been before. Each screening location features highly trained pharmacists who are uniquely positioned to support those who need it. We look forward to this continued journey of improving health outcomes for all.

Health system leaders face unprecedented challenges in modern medicine, and the call to address them is urgent. The shift to #valuebasedcare is crucial for health systems in enhancing patient outcomes and ensuring financial sustainability. Continued improvement in managing the cost of care will produce significant growth in the long-term.
 
Now is the time for health systems to invest in VBC infrastructure and innovative technologies. And there is no need to go it alone!
 
Access our new blog on the strategic imperative of value-based care for health systems and prepare to thrive. https://bit.ly/3xruh4x

#populationhealth #healthcarestrategy

Welcome Georgia-based AA Med Care to Help at Home! 

We’re expanding our Georgia service area to meet the growing demand for seniors and disabled populations who want to age in place in their own homes.

“We’re excited to welcome the clients and caregivers of AA Med Care to Help at Home,” said Georgia Market Leader Ben Light. “As we continue our growth strategy, we have the ability to provide home care access to more and more seniors and disabled populations in the Georgia community who want the opportunity to age-in-place as independently as possible in their own homes.” 

Want to learn more about Help at Home? Visit us at www.helpathome.com.

 #HelpatHome #HomeCare #QualityCare #WeAreGrowing #Georgia

We understand the difficulty that some communities face when it comes to accessing information about #energyefficiency and getting the support they need to implement changes. That is why we have launched Round 2 of the Community Partnership Initiative, which is helping to provide more opportunities for residents and businesses to access our programs and lower their energy bills.
 
With Eversource Energy awarding the majority of the grants for Round 2 funding of the Partnership, we are extremely proud of our community partners and project teams for driving deeper engagement with Energize Connecticut programs for disadvantaged customers. As I share in a recent interview with The Hartford Courant, Round 2 specifically targeted #environmentaljustice communities to ensure that they are included in our larger efforts towards #decarbonization, and our project teams are currently working toward a 10 percent increase in enrollment with the programs they have chosen to promote.
 
Subscribers to the Courant can read the article in full, and learn more about our recent work with Connecticut communities through the Community Partnership Initiative.

The Energize Connecticut Community Partnership Initiative is connecting our customers in new ways to energy efficiency programs and solutions that will ultimately help lower their costs, lower their carbon footprint and provide greater comfort at home. Tilak Subrahmanian and team are doing a great job in the second round of this project, working closely with our communities to make energy efficiency more accessible to our customers. I encourage subscribers of the The Hartford Courant to give this article a read to learn more.
column11: Executive VP, Customer Experience and Energy Strategy at Eversource Energy

column2:
The Nicor Gas Energy Efficiency Program is committed to helping our customers save energy and money while keeping their operations running smoothly and sustainably. This week, our team celebrated our work with Kensing Solutions! After installing a regenerative thermal oxidizer, Kensing received a $350,000 energy efficiency incentive for the project and is expected to save 636,000 therms during the first year alone. We are excited to continue to help Kensing achieve their sustainability and energy efficiency goals. To learn more about our business offerings, visit 
nicorgas.com/bizsavings

A new level of service has arrived at JFK! On Tuesday, we opened the first ultra-premium Delta One Lounge. We were joined by nearly 600 guests, including some of our most loyal Diamond Medallion and 360 members, to celebrate this monumental occasion and be the first to experience a new standard of elevated service.
 
The 39,000 square foot lounge features multiple luxurious areas to recharge and relax, including the Icon Bar with premium wines and spirits, the elegant Brasserie with full-service dining, and a Wellness Room with state-of-the-art amenities and treatments. No matter what kind of traveler you are, the Delta One Lounge has something tailored for you.
 
At Delta Air Lines, we know that your experience on the ground is just as important as your experience in the air. We can’t wait to welcome our Delta One passengers for a truly unforgettable experience. 

#Experience #DeltaOne #Lounge #Premium #Airport #JFK
column23: Oh cool! I will definitely arrive early for my flight on Sunday to check this out !!

Making sense of the vast amounts of data we have in healthcare is a significant challenge. At Zelis, our mission is to modernize the healthcare financial experience by enabling our clients to leverage actionable insights from their data to improve care. 

Thanks, Gunjan Khanna, and the McKinsey & Company team for talking with me about price transparency data and how it is enabling improved member engagement in healthcare.

Listen to the McKinsey on Healthcare podcast here: https://lnkd.in/eM-NCdGy
